transportAdvice: Sydney has an extensive public transit network including trains, buses, light rail, and ferries that connect most major tourist areas, making it easy to get around without a car. Taxis and rideshare vehicles are widely available, and the central areas around the CBD, Darling Harbour, and The Rocks are very walkable.

weather.description: Hot summer month with warm nights and occasional afternoon thunderstorms; beach weather but humidity can feel oppressive.
Similar to January with warm, humid conditions and the highest average rainfall of the year; storms are common.
Late summer transitioning to autumn; still warm and humid with occasional heavy rain events.
Comfortable autumn weather with mild temperatures and lower humidity; a pleasant time to explore the city.
Cooler and drier conditions settle in; clear skies and mild days make this a great month for sightseeing.
Winter begins with cool, crisp days and cold nights; generally dry and sunny with low humidity.
The coolest month of the year with clear blue skies and dry conditions; layers are needed especially in the morning and evening.
Still cool but days begin to lengthen; dry and sunny weather makes it comfortable for outdoor activities.
Spring arrives with warming temperatures and blooming jacarandas; pleasant and mostly dry conditions.
Warm spring weather with increasing sunshine; occasional showers but generally a very enjoyable month to visit.
Warming quickly toward summer with longer days; some afternoon storms possible but overall bright and inviting.
Early summer with hot days, festive atmosphere, and the famous New Year's Eve fireworks; humidity rises noticeably.
